reviewText:
First, I want to say thank you. Thank you for putting bots into your game let alone bots with ranging difficulty. You have no idea what that means to a player like myself. Steamified has already featured a number of promising multiplayer titles that are local multiplayer only or if they do have online multiplayer that the game is dead on arrival because the developers and publishers don’t have the marketing budget to get a large enough playerbase for their pay to play game. Therefore if you’re going to have a game that is primarily a multiplayer game please include bots. They make a game that could otherwise be pointless to be developed – even if the concept is sound and the gameplay exciting – playable until such a point as your game has an active community or you make a group of like minded friends who are able to party with you.

This alone gives Bell Ringer a glimmer of hope. It’s not going to be DoA due to the inability to get a game going. However, that alone doesn’t mean that it has a saving grace. The game itself still needs to be good and polished if it is going to gain any sort of community at all. I personally believe that the March 6th release date is pretty optimistic. The game still needs a fair amount of work. For instance, the game will not recognize my Xbox One controller. The game states that it comes with full controller support. I would suggest that that it is partial at best – I have read others who have been able to use their controllers. The keyboard controls are average at best and downright scary at worst. If you want to have the ability for players to enjoy your title local co-op you need to fix the controls all of the way through. I know that the devs are working on this but we shall see how it progresses.

Another issue that I have to take issue with may be in part because I found the controls dodgy and that’s the difficulty level of the bots. Even the bots on the lower end of the difficulty spectrum tend to kick ♥♥♥. A friend of mine who played the game is a fighting game genius – to the point where he has done extremely well in professional tournaments – and he agrees that the game needs to offer newbies a glimmer of hope and that he didn’t always win as comfortably as he generally would. On the higher difficulty settings this would be a beacon for action players of his level but if you’re new to the game and unable to sniff a victory there is a likelihood that you will give up before putting the time into get to the required level.

I’d also like to see more characters on release. Give the game some diversity. If I play a series of 5-player games it would be nice to see a round where there’s at least one different character in the mix. But that may be a wish list item rather than a realistic one.

The sound and the graphics are very generic. Too generic. But good sound costs money and it’s clear that this is a shoestring budget game and that a lot of resources would have gone into developing the AI of the bots, etc. to make the game playable which I would argue is more important than the aesthetics. However, I’d like to see them improved. The music on the menu systems is great and I’d like to advise that you incorporate some sort of soundtrack into the game to help hide the generic fighting sounds.

One final suggestion to the devs is to please reconsider your choice of trailer video on the Steam page. Yes, gameplay video is very important, but I believe firmly that you’re not doing justice to your game or advertising it very well with that trailer. Cut the menu crap out. Get to the gameplay. Add some music or something to it to make it sound and look more exciting. Right now it’s just a few people playing the game – people that we do not know and do not have a reason to care about. Perhaps do a character trailer where you show off each character. If you have an animator then give each character a comic book style story so that we have a reason to know and care about each fighter. Are any of them bad? Are any of them good? Are they anything but generic? What is their background? Why are they in this battle? Which characters are rivals and why? A relatively basic story trailer would add more depth not only to the trailer but to your game. It’s all a little plain and generic right now and you have room to grow.

If I have to say “yes” or “no” for right now then I’m going to give a cautious yes but that’s solely because of the bots. After playing a number of local multiplayer or dead online multiplayer games it’s a healthy sign to see a developer ensure that their game isn’t going to meet the same unfortunate fate that those games have.

For similar reviews and our popular daily giveaways (generally 3 new ones per day) visit http://www.steamified.com/
Feel free to join us on Steam at http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Steamified

reviewText:
I read reviews. I expected cheap as dirt worst game ever. People say like it's the worst game ever.

Community tricked me again. It's not. It's just mediocre, you jump around and slash some fantasy monsters (or your friends). And that's it.
It doesn't crash, I have 60fps on my 5yo old PC with everything maxed out. It's not downright ugly (UE4 makes everything shiny even if it's not supposed to be shiny), it's not downright broken. It's just mediocre, unpolished and low on content game. I've seen worse. Much, much worse.
Community needs to stop overreacting over the smallest things. Yeah, we are buying and enjoying expectations and PR words these days, but can we stop making a fuzz about nothing at very least?
I mean it's super-cheap and it's not the best game ever. But it could give a stupid hour of jumping around before you idle for cards and delete it. Don't pretend like it's price dented your wallet, you aren't poor african kid. It cost 24 cents for me and I got my hour of not-so-fun. The game is just ultra-cheap 'meh'.

On the bright side devs are still working on their game, and that's some dedication. I just want to support the devs (GO BUY ORBITAL GEAR, IT'S GREAT GAME, SRSLY)

p.s.: I say jump around because stationary moves are slow and useless (and hitboxes are way off). Use downward mid-air moves.

reviewText:
This would have been a better game if it came out in the 90's.

Looks unpolished from the start menu.
-Many of the menu options overlap each other so you can't select the option you want for a few of them with the mouse.  You end up having to fiddle with the options using the keyboard.
-As far as I can tell changing the resolution does nothing.
-The font style makes it hard to tell, at a glance, what actions are tied to what keybinds.  In fact the 'x' in game looks like the letter 'e'.
-To go back to the main menu to start the game I press the ack" button.

This feels and looks like a free flash game.
Most games will give you an explanation of what your different abilities do or how the basics of the game work.  Here you have to figure it all out on your own.  Which is fine
date: but the game play just isn't fun.  Enemies just run at you
hoursPlayed: hit them with a random speacial skill

reviewText:
So I saw this game get a ton of negative feedback and decided, I liked Orbital Gear enough to try this out as I picked it up for 60 something cents. I was expecting a complete and utter failer and on that note I was plesantly surprised. See I love picking up little indie games like this and playing it with friends at my house, and this game is fitting in perfectly.

I am recommending this SOLELY based on the local multiplayer. The controls are clunky, (glad they fixed the 1 hit KOs), no balance between bots (either they're too bad or too good).

Is it worth the $6.99? No. But it's definately worth $1. So pick it up when it's on sale, gather a few of your friends and get at least an hour or two of entertainment.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=URePYioiEFw

reviewText:
Product received for free

Bell Ringer is an indie platform figher game in the likes of Smash Bros, but with a much darker tone.

This game use Unreal 4 (game not for low PC)

As with any brawler it takes some time to get the hang of each characters playstyle and find your favorite fighter.
All characters are unique enough and have their own weapons and special attacks.

The game offers bots with varied difficulty, and also online multiplayer (but havn't gotten around to try that out yet).

The sound effects are good and the music is very fitting to the games atmosphere.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Bell Ringer is an indie platform figher game in the likes of Smash Bros, but with a much darker tone.

As with any brawler it takes some time to get the hang of each characters playstyle and find your favorite fighter.
All characters are unique enough and have their own weapons and special attacks.

The game offers bots with varied difficulty, and also online multiplayer (but havn't gotten around to try that out yet).

The sound effects are good and the music is very fitting to the games atmosphere.

All in all the game is a bit rough around the edges and I've found a few bugs, but it's still in early access.
There'll probably be more characters and levels to choose from in later updates.

reviewText:
This could have been great but there is a that list:

Refreshing the server will crash the game.
Hosting a game with friends will turn them invincible except their weapons.
They also move like you move characters like you have 900+ ping on other games.
Lucia's Whack a Mole special always a one shot kill.
The controls guide and the controls itself on the keyboard will confuse alot of players.

Yeah this game would have been a great SSB Dark Souls version if it weren't for those things in the list.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Honestly, this game is not worth it whether you bought it or got it free from Bundle Stars/giveaways.

The combat system that's said to be fast is actually VERY slow. There are no combos that can be performed. It's just pushing buttons while moving in a certain direction and hoping for the best.

The singleplayer is too short and is very easily beated. Nearly every enemy will die in one hit if you hold left bumper and attack (which is some kind of upwards attack). Just repeat this until you win because the bosses are even a joke. Of which the fourth level has none.

Multiplayer is essentially a dead game. I sat for minutes just waiting for a game and only one game showed up, passworded and for two people. No one ever joined him. But what I'm reading from other reviews, the host always has priority in the matches anyways, either dealing superior damage, or taking no damage at all.


All in all, the game looks nice, but it is VERY poorly executed and could have used another several months to a year of development. It is not worth it.

reviewText:
Screenshots are misleading. Only reason i played this game so long is because of trading cards.

This could be a foundation for something, a concept but not a finished product.. There is nothing that this game does good  or ineteresting besides the artstyle (in my opinion).  Combat is boring, very janky and the game is not even properly optimised to run.  Honnestly i don't know why they thought this game would sell at this state. They should take notes from games like 'The showdown effect' where combat is fun and fluid, cause right now it's not worth it's price, not by a long shot.

Take your game back to the workshop, because it's not done. There are several older both indie and  AAA titles for this price.

reviewText: I got a free key today and I can tell you this game is pretty poor. I had some small hope that this would be a half decent Smash Bros clone but it's really disappointing. I applaud the devs because they are a small group of young folk and it is quite an achievement to put out a game that works at all. Unfortunately, despite generally functioning it's not a fun or well executed game at all. The art and music assets show some potential but barely approach mediocre at present. Level design is completely bland. The gameplay is just plain broken.\n\nAs others have mentioned, hitboxes are all wrong with some moves passing right through enemies while others seem to hit from absurd distances. The AI is both completely stupid and (without exploiting a glaring bug) sometimes overwhelmingly powerful. An example of the former is enemies who approach but don't actually get close enough to hit you and then keep attacking the air. An example of the latter is the single player level" where you fight silhouettes of the other playable characters. It's nearly impossible to kill two dozen enemies that can kill you in one hit
date: especially when they are all on top of each other attacking you all at the same time. The only way I found to win was running away and backing against a wall which apparently stupefies enemies completely.\n\nI recommend against this game even if you see it for free. It's not worth the 20-30 minutes I put into it."

reviewText:
If you like to button smash, then this is the game for you. A friend of mines played a game with me and we duked it out without knowing how to play...
But goodness gracious, this game sucks! I mean, the hitboxes are really small and the only way you can win is with a OHK. It feels like you are using strats on freaking Super Smash Bros and the only strats you'll be using is the power abilities. Then they have the nerve to call it fast-paced. A freaking frozen hot pocket could thaw faster than this; I thought this game was going to be immaculate, and I was wrong.
But a free game is a free game!

I had the audacity to try singleplayer. In fact, it is worse than the multiplayer. The AI knows the points to your hitbox, and you can't even hit them back. This game is in need of a major fixing

reviewText:
I thought the negative reviews were exaggerated.
I was wrong.
It is actually a good idea (Smash Bros. x Dark Souls), but is brought to life poorly. The controls are difficult, the game itself is difficult to learn. Plus, it's quite laggy for the type of game it says to be.
Just don't.

reviewText:
Bell Ringer is a game targeted towards online multiplayer arenas.
This is all well and good except for the fact that nobody plays multiplayer. I never once found a server I could join.

The graphics are poor, and the single player mode is terrible. I got this game for free. the only good I got out of it was the free trading cards. Dont buy, its not fun.

reviewText:
I got this as a free game. After I installed it I went to the store page and saw the reviews were mostly negative. So here is my review.

Starts up game
Tries out single player
Presses buttons to see what the controls are
Game freezes
Waits a few seconds
Alt+F4
Uninstalls game

Would not Super Dark Smash Souls again

3/10

reviewText:
Not yet. (probably never ever)
Played through the single player, had no motivation left to start the mp.
Hit reactions (sfx, vfx, animation) are too weak.
Controls are horrid as attack variations overlap with movement controls.
Visuals are traumatizingly ugly.
Overall combat flow has some potential, but basics like invul in hit reaction is missing, so expect instant death situations.

reviewText: look at the acheivement stats for this game. the first one requires you to win one match. At time of writing, 3% of this game's players have that badge. reviewText:
All attacks but S are useless, just spam the S key. Dodging (or moving in general) is not recommended; it's best to remain ignorant as to how terrible the movement is in this game.

This is what you would expect as a prototype for a game, not an actual game that would be on steam. There needs to be some basic ground of quality assurance on Steam, the devs of this game (and so many other games) should have taken a serious redesign and development before shitpòsting it here.

And no, I did not buy this game. Some dumbass bought the game for my sister.
